posts.body:
>>efab3dc4-bdf2-493a-88ce-72fd649755bc
Site owners will never accept to decentralize because besides all the technical problems, it reduces their power and moves it over to the users, which diminishes the amount of money they can squeeze out of owning the site (even more so if the p2p software is free software and the centralized one isn't, since then people who want an alternative to centralized shit not only have to cover server costs but also replicate the software as opposed to just spinning up another instance and letting seeders do their thing).
